newsitem.title: INDIA: Indian cotton mill buying low ahead of budget.
newsitem.headline: Indian cotton mill buying low ahead of budget.

text.p: Indian cotton prices extended gains on the local market on Thursday, dealers said.

Mill buying remained low ahead of Friday's national budget but expectation of more exports helped prices to regain fresh ground. In spot deals Bengal-deshi rose by 5/10 rupees to 790/830 rupees per maund (37.32 kg) while Punjab saw-ginned gained by 15 rupees to 1,425/1,640 rupees per maund.
Gujarat Kalyan (medium-staple) rose by 200 rupees to 11,400/11,600 rupees per candy (355.56 kg).
The government has allowed cotton exports of 1.22 million bales (170 kg each) and traders were expecting fresh export permission for about 200,000/300,000 bales.
